conversation.content: So basically someone's been. Having a party. With my credit card.
Oh no, I'm really sorry to hear that! Let me pull up your account right away—what's the... hmm, the card number ending in?
It's it's 4782. Like, three charges I definitely didn't make.

Got it, account ending in 4782, I'm seeing it now. Okay so there's a charge for $89.99 at something called "GameVault Digital," then $156.00 at "TechnoMart Online," and uh... wait, there's another one for $234.50 at "ElectroHub Pro." Are these the ones?
Yeah those those are them. GameVault? Really? What am I, twelve?

I totally understand how frustrating this must be. Let me start the dispute process right away—I'll need to assign case number FRD-2847-XK to this, and um, first thing, have you still got physical possession of your card?
I mean. Yeah it's right here. Which is the... what's the word... the weird part.

Hmm, that does make it interesting—probably an online breach then. So what I'm gonna do is freeze this card immediately with security code HALT-8829, issue you a new one, and er... the new card will be express shipped, arrival tracking XPS-44921-B.
Wait wait wait. I need—I need my card though. Tomorrow.
Oh absolutely, I hear you! The express shipping I mentioned, that's actually overnight delivery—you'll have it by 10 AM tomorrow, guaranteed with that tracking XPS-44921-B.
Oh. Okay so that's... sorry, I'm just. This whole thing is stressing me out.

No no, please don't apologize! This happened to me last year actually—someone bought like $400 worth of, get this, bird supplies? I don't even have a bird! But seriously, we'll get this sorted, and those three charges will be credited back within 24-48 hours under claim CLM-7736-RC.
Bird supplies? That's... okay that's actually pretty funny.

Right? Like what were they planning, opening a pet store? Anyway, um, let me just... make sure everything's set here. Your new card ending in 9903 ships tonight, and I'm adding a security alert flag SAF-1122 to your account.
So basically I don't have to—to pay for any of those charges right?
Correct, you're fully protected! Those fraudulent charges totaling $480.49 will be reversed, reference number REV-8827-TM, and you won't be responsible for a single penny.
Okay okay okay. That's. Good. Really good actually.
Perfect! Oh, one more thing—I'm setting up text alerts with code TXT-ALRT-5566 so you'll get notified instantly for any transaction over $50. Would that help give you some peace of mind?
Yeah that's—sorry I was so. You know. At the beginning there.

Are you kidding? You were totally fine! I'd be frustrated too if someone was out there pretending to be a twelve-year-old gamer with my credit card. Your case FRD-2847-XK is all set, and seriously, call us anytime if you need anything else, okay?

scenario: reporting unauthorized transactions on their account
